name: Riverside Casino & Golf Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I received a coupon in the mail from Riverside, offering me a rate similar to most hotels in Iowa City. I had only been there once previously (to gamble) and I thought I'd take advantage of their offer. THIS WONDERFUL HOTEL rivals anything Las Vegas may offer. The rooms were grandly appointed, with HUGE showers encased in plexiglass, premium bedding and spa-like products in the bathroom.
reviews.title: TOTAL LUXURY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If only I hadn't lost so much gambling...this was a FABULOUS room!
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel! Our room was gorgeous and overlooked the pool area where you could swim from outside to an indoor pool. Casino staff was great! We bought a package deal that I would recommend that included a lunch or breakfast buffet and dinner buffet. Nicest hotel in Iowa I have stayed at!
reviews.title: An excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved it here, $89.95, plus tax, total was $100.75.
reviews.title: Nightmare in Riverside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was huge, the bathroom was huge & a fun walk in shower with a see through
reviews.title: Nice, I mean Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were on a road trip and found the Riverside Casino & Golf Resort a beautiful surprise. Located about ten minutes south of Iowa City, the resort is very clean, upscale, and uncrowded. The hotel rooms were very lavish for what I would expect in Iowa, with a cool glassed in shower and electric curtains. There is a nice ice cream shop in the lobby, which also has breakfast goodies if you do not want the buffet. There are two or three places to eat in the resort, but we did not use them as it was just an overnight stay.
reviews.title: Hidden Treasure in Iowa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have little kids, and we are not really into gambling... but still enjoyed this place. It is a bargain compared to other big box hotels in the surrounding area.... we highly recommend it.
reviews.title: We were amazed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for our anniversary. My mother had actually won a nights stay and gave it to us as a gift. We were amazed at how clean and fancy this hotel was. The curtains ( bathroom and window) were electric, meaning they were activated by a switch to open and close. The bathroom curtain covered a glass wall separating the bathroom and bedroom. Nice size flat screen t.v. on the wall. Very nice room, would definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Can't Wait to Go Back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Riverside has everything you would ever need or want in a destination hotel. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous! The room was huge with a refrigerator, flat screen tv, coffemaker, lots of closet space, a safe and the biggest shower I've ever seen! The shower curtain and the window drapes were electric which was also pretty cool. . . Since this is a newer hotel the room smelled clean and was spotless and the beds were really comfortable. The only complaint I would have is that there was no wireless internet. If you're into gambling the casino makes you feel like you're in Vegas. There are several eating options but the only one we ate at was the buffet for breakfast. It offered a wide variety of selections including an omelet bar and every topping imaginable for waffles. The food was pretty good and there was plenty of it but it wasn't too hot which was unfortunate. However, the hotel and the room itself definitely made up for it and I can't wait to go back! There are gift shops, a clothing store, a golf shop and a spa. I wouldn't recommend the Riverside for a family vacation with young kids just because there isn't a whole lot for little kids to do. All in all the Riverside definitely impressed me!
reviews.title: Nice Rooms Here's What Happened

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Riverside Hotel and Casino is overall a good place to stay and play. We stayed 3 nights at the end of June 2011.
reviews.title: Very disappointing since last time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I traveled to this resort-casino-golf course setting for a concert featuring Peter Cetera on February 11th. Why he was booked here seemed odd but we drove the 250 miles and stayed at the hotel and were delighted to see Peter Cetera in person on that Saturday night. The hotel was very modern and surrounded by an extensive golf course which no one was playing on due to the 10 degree weather in early February. The check in process was quick and easy. The rooms were modern, well decorated with an unusual glass walled shower that had electric curtains that opened and closed with a switch. The widows also had an electric motor that opened and closed them. Not what we usually find but nonetheless, very nice. We eat 2 meals in the casino restaurants, one of which was the buffett. The food was ok, not super-fancy but good enough for us. The casino was busy (and smokey) so after the concert we did some people-watching and ended our evening early. This will never be a destination for us but we were well-treated and surprised to find this type of place off the beaten path in southeastern Iowa.
reviews.title: Way Off the Beaten Path!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: There's always something happening at Riverside. Great bands, new machines and a non smoking section. The hotel rooms are nice too. The buffet leaves a little to be desired.
reviews.title: Great local casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Riverside hotel is one of the best hotels that I have stayed in. It is a little pricey but worth it. The indoor/outdoor pool is well maintained and is really nice in the summer. We have stayed here many times over the past 3 years and have never been disappointed with anything with this hotel. Sometimes the Riverside hotel Honor's hotel offers from other Midwest casino hotels for free rooms. Once you have visited this casino you should get offers in the mail if you get their card and use it in the casino. All of their rooms are nice and if you get a nonsmoking room it doesn't smell like smoke. All the employees that we interacted with were friendly and helpful. The table dealers and pit bosses were friendly and helpful. The only thing that I could say negative is that this casino is tight with comps and you have to buy your alcoholic drinks like beer or mixed drinks.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancé and I recently took a weekend away to Riverside Casino and Resort this past weekend. While it was too cold to fully enjoy all of the amenities (Golf course), we still took advantage of the large pool/spa area and the eateries the site had to offer. The pool looks like it really heats up during the warmer months with an outdoor walk-up bar and indoor/outdoor swimming area.
reviews.title: Nice casino floor / Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had free tickets to the buffet but apparently this is the only place to eat in town as the line extended for what looked like a 3 hour wait. We cut somebody a deal on our tickets and ate at one of the restaurants (surprisingly only a 30 minute wait). Decent food, I'd place it somewhere just above an Applebee’s / Chillis. I’m sure the steak house can suit the finer pallets.
reviews.title: night ranger concert/hotel pkg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I thought the prices at the Riverside Hotel Spa were pricey,but I had no idea how pricey they were until a few weeks after my visit. That's when tests results came back positive for a bacterial virus called pseudomonus. The infection is painful and has caused me to miss a week of work. Pseudomonus is caused from hot tubs that are not properly maintained. I'd like to say that the problem is taken care of, but I am not convinced by the management. My girls' spa day ended up being quite more than I bargained for. Not the relaxing day of pampering I had in mind!
reviews.title: Beware of SPA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: What a wonderful casino/hotel! It is so fancy, nice and new! Rooms are awesome! Huge bathroom/shower. Automatic curtains on the window and shower. Huge work/office/computer station in the room. Fridge, safe, hairdryer, make up mirror and coffee maker in room. The grounds at the hotel are pure luxury. Shops/Spa/Pool/Restaurants/Bars and a huge casino floor with water falls surrounding it. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The casino is not smokey and very nice with a huge selection of machines. I got a players card and I hope I get some deals in the mail as I'd love to go back. Only odd thing. NO STAR TREK SLOT MACHINES! Isn't Riverside the birthplace of Captain Kirk?? :)
reviews.title: LAS VEGAS STYLE CASINO RIGHT HERE IN IOWA!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was very nice and comfortable beds. Big flat screen tv, awesome showers. There is a maginification make-up mirror and complimentary make-up remover cloths. The casino has great entertainment. There was a house band playing at night which was very good, but the night we were there a tribute band to Earth, Wind and Fire was there. They put on an excellent show at no extra charge.
reviews.title: Very Nice Rooms-Comfortable beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: In the morning we went to the breakfast buffet. There were so many choices and the food was delicious. I don't usually like buffets, but this was really good. The price was $8.99.
reviews.title: reasonable for the are

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was here for a single night with my mom and cousin. We went to an event that was located at the resort than stayed the night. The staff was friendly and the room was spacious and clean. I don't really gamble, so I was not that impressed with the casino area. Even though we were in the Non-smoking section, I could still smell the smoke. We ate the breakfast buffet and again was not that impressed. For almost $10, I thought the food was cold. Even thought we got our rooms at a discount price ($70) compared to the normal cost ($150ish), I'm not sure I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: A HIDDEN TREASURE IN IOWA!

description: What does it mean to Live it Up? You'll find out the moment you enter Riverside Casino & Golf Resort™. From the magnificent fountains that greet you as you approach the main entrance to the luxurious surroundings of our casino, hotel, spa, golf course, event center, indoor/outdoor pool and multiple food outlets, every aspect of Riverside Casino & Golf Resort™ is designed for one special reason - your total enjoyment.
